Others: The ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024 promises thrilling cricket action across six Caribbean islands and the US.
The tournament structure involves four groups, each consisting of five teams.
The top two teams from each group will progress to the Super Eight phase, paving the way for the knockout semi-finals and the ultimate final.
The semi-final matches will be hosted in Trinidad and Tobago and Guyana, leading up to the final, which is scheduled for Barbados on June 29, marking the culmination of the tournament.
The 20 participating teams have been divided into four groups.
From each group, the top two teams will progress to the Super 8s stage.
During this phase, the qualifying teams will be divided into two groups of four.
Subsequently, the top two teams from each group will secure berths in the semifinals, leading to the culminating final match.
